page.title: 03Farming in Stackpole
page.content: A combination of last year's surplus crops,cheap imports and a disastrously poor summer are all reasons for the poor state of the industry.Growing potatoes is especially important to the local economy,because the mild climate enables them to be planted and harvested earlier than in other parts of the British Isles. Sheep are also brought down in the winter by the hill farmers of the Preseli area to graze in the warmer climate of the Stackpole region.The rent accruing from this practice is a valuable addition to the local farmers' income. The grain grown locally is of a poor quality and can only be used as cattle food; this is because the climate is too wet. All the farmers are tenants, the land is owned by an insurance trust.
